algorithm_technique: Depth First Search (DFS) to traverse islands and check for sub-island conditions.
problem_summary_simple: Count islands in grid2 that are entirely contained within islands in grid1.
problem_summary_technical: Uses DFS on grid2 to identify islands. During traversal, it checks if all land cells in grid2 correspond to land cells in grid1.
key_insights: An island in grid2 is a sub-island if every '1' in that island in grid2 is also a '1' in grid1.
The DFS function should return a boolean indicating if the current island is a sub-island.
Marking visited cells (by setting to 0) prevents recounting and infinite loops.
